articles.author: Jonathan Landay
articles.description: Two U.S. researchers say they have identified the probable deployment site in Russia of the 9M370 Burevestnik, a new nuclear-powered, nuclear-armed cruise missile touted by President Vladimir Putin as "invincible."
articles.title: Exclusive: US researchers find probable launch site of Russia's new nuclear-powered missile

articles.author: Jonathan Saul, Kanishka Singh
articles.description: Yemen's Iran-backed Houthi rebels attacked two crude oil tankers - the Saudi-flagged Amjad and the Panama-flagged Blue Lagoon I - in the Red Sea on Monday, the U.S. military said, calling the assaults "reckless acts of terrorism".
articles.title: US military says Yemen's Houthis attacked two crude oil tankers in Red Sea

articles.author: Jessie Pang
articles.description: The last batch of 45 Hong Kong activists entered their final pleas on Tuesday for light sentences in a landmark national security trial over charges that they had formed a "conspiracy to subvert the state power".
articles.title: 'Hong Kong 47': Court wraps up mitigation hearing in city’s largest national security case

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Venezuela's attorney general's office on Monday requested an arrest warrant be issued for opposition leader Edmundo Gonzalez, after Gonzalez failed to respond to three summons to testify about an opposition website which published detailed results of the country's disputed presidential election.
articles.title: Venezuela attorney general requests arrest warrant for opposition leader Gonzalez

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian forces are advancing faster in eastern Ukraine than they have done for a long time, taking several square kilometres per day, President Vladimir Putin said on Monday as Moscow's forces tried to smash through a Ukrainian defensive line.
articles.title: Putin says Russia advancing fast in eastern Ukraine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An eight-year-old boy was among two people killed in Russian attacks on Ukraine's southeastern region of Zaporizhzhia, while a third died in a missile attack on the central city of Dnipro, regional governors said.
articles.title: Three die in Russia's attacks across Ukraine, officials say

articles.author: Subrata Nag Choudhury
articles.description: India's federal police said it had arrested the former principal of R.G. Kar Medical College in Kolkata for alleged graft, after an investigation in the case of the brutal rape and murder of a young female doctor on the premises.
articles.title: Ex-head of Indian college where doctor was raped arrested for suspected graft

articles.author: Mikhail Flores
articles.description: At least 13 people have died in the Philippines due to tropical storm Yagi, while schools and government offices were closed in Manila and nearby provinces on Tuesday because of expected bad weather.
articles.title: Philippines death toll from tropical storm Yagi rises to 13

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Democratic Republic of Congo's government said at least 129 people were killed while trying to escape from the central Makala prison in the capital Kinshasa late on Sunday, adding that the situation was now under control.
articles.title: DR Congo government says 129 killed in attempted prison break

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Pope Francis arrived on Tuesday in Indonesia, the first leg of an ambitious four-country Asia-Pacific tour in which he is expected to urge global action on climate change.
articles.title: Pope Francis arrives in Indonesia to begin ambitious Asia-Pacific tour
